attributes.action: change the law so that people may not drive any vehicle following alcohol entering the body, for a number of hours.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
"Any amount of alcohol affects your ability to drive safely.
Effects are slower reactions, larger stopping distance, worse judgement of speed & distance, lower field of vision. 
Alcohol makes you over-confident and more likely to take risks driving, increasing danger to all road users, even yourself.
2x the legal alcohol limit (80 mg of alcohol in 100 ml of blood) you are at least 50 times more likely to be involved in a fatal car crash compared to a driver who has not been drinking.
There is no failsafe guide as to how much you can drink and still drive safely. Many factors can vary it. 
The only safe option is not to drink if you plan to drive.”*
*Taken from government website ‘THINK!’ –it shows it is not safe to drink-drive, yet the government has not banned it.
Working with young people makes me aware that many believe, because of the limit, up to the legal amount it is 100% safe to drive after having drunk alcohol. It isn’t acceptable-please help show the government now!
